Name: fairfax_county_2007_bldg
Originator: Fairfax County GIS Branch Department of Information Technology
OriginatorSort: Fairfax County GIS Branch Department of Information Technology
Abstract: This layer contains the buildings that have been captured through various processes.  The original data in this layer was captured during the 1997-2000 data conversion effort for Fairfax County.  The building footprints were captured using stereo models.  Since then the GIS office has captured building rooftops from ortho photography by performing heads up digitizing.  Prior to receiving the ortho photography, site plans are used to capture the planned building footprints.  These different sources of the buildings are indicated within the building attributes as well as the type of building.
FgdcText:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<metadata>
  <idinfo>
    <citation>
      <citeinfo>
        <origin>Fairfax County GIS Branch Department of Information Technology</origin>
        <pubdate>19991101</pubdate>
        <title>Buildings, Fairfax County, VA 1999</title>
        <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>
        <pubinfo>
          <pubplace>Fairfax County, Virginia, USA</pubplace>
          <publish>Fairfax County Government</publish>
        </pubinfo>
      <ftname Sync="TRUE">fairfax_county_2007_bldg</ftname>
</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>This layer contains the buildings that have been captured through various processes.  The original data in this layer was captured during the 1997-2000 data conversion effort for Fairfax County.  The building footprints were captured using stereo models.  Since then the GIS office has captured building rooftops from ortho photography by performing heads up digitizing.  Prior to receiving the ortho photography, site plans are used to capture the planned building footprints.  These different sources of the buildings are indicated within the building attributes as well as the type of building.</abstract>
      <purpose>There are various purposes for the buildings layer.  One purpose is to identify the buildings and assign attributes to them (building type, address, etc.).  Another is to identify impervious surfaces.</purpose>
    </descript>
    <timeperd>
      <timeinfo>
        <mdattim>
          <sngdate>
            <caldate>1997</caldate>
          </sngdate>
          <sngdate>
            <caldate>2002</caldate>
          </sngdate>
          <sngdate>
            <caldate>2003</caldate>
          </sngdate>
        </mdattim>
      </timeinfo>
      <current>publication date</current>
    </timeperd>
    <status>
      <progress>Complete</progress>
      <update>Funding and need by County agencies will play a key role in if and how often this layer will be updated.</update>
    </status>
    <spdom>
      <bounding>
        <westbc>-77.5431</westbc>
        <eastbc>-77.0354</eastbc>
        <northbc>39.0610</northbc>
        <southbc>38.6189</southbc>
      </bounding>
    </spdom>
    <keywords>
      <theme>
        <themekt>Building</themekt>
        <themekey>Footprints</themekey>
        <themekey>Rooftop</themekey>
      </theme>
      <place>
        <placekt>Fairfax County</placekt>
        <placekey>Virginia</placekey>

      </place>
    </keywords>
    <accconst>None, Please see “Distribution Info” for details</accconst>
    <useconst>Please refer to the Fairfax County GIS branch for information on which areas are the most current.  Acknowledgement of the Fairfax County GIS branch would be appreciated in products derived from these data.</useconst>
    <ptcontac>
      <cntinfo>
        <cntorgp>
          <cntorg>Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services</cntorg>
        </cntorgp>
        <cntpos>Database Administrator</cntpos>
        <cntaddr>
          <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype>

    </ptcontac>
    <datacred>The data set was created by Analytical Surveys Incorporated (ASI) and Landata under contract to Fairfax County.  Quality control checks were performed by Engineering Systems Incorporated and Dewberry and Davis.  Staff from the GIS branch were also used for quality control checking.</datacred>
    <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780</native>
  </idinfo>
  <dataqual>
    <attracc>
      <attraccr>Attribute accuracy was tested by comparing the values of the attributes with property maps to find the building name.  The draw symbol attribute was checked by plotting the features on the standard map product and ensuring the features appeared and were drawn correctly.  The building type was checked by reviewing the zoning layer when the building type was not obvious.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>Segments making up the outer and inner boundaries of a polygon tie end-to-end to completely enclose the area.  No duplicate features exist.  Intersecting lines are separated into individual line segments at the point of intersection.  All nodes are represented by a single coordinate pair, which indicates the beginning or end of a line segment.  Logical consistency was tested by visual inspection and automated quality control procedures.</logic>
    <complete>All buildings visible on the aerial photography are mapped.  Some structures may obscure some building features and therefore not be completely captured.  A detailed on the ground analysis of a site could produce updates to this data.  All buildings that were greater than 200 square feet in area were captured.  The updates capture all buildings that were see on the 2002 VGIN orthophotography with an image resolution of 1 foot per pixel.  The building rooftops are captured by zooming in far enough to see several buildings at a time and then heads up digitizing them.  If they are seen on the photography then they are captured.  The linework may be skewed due to building lean or visibility of the buildings themselves.</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>Horizontal positional accuracy for the digital data is tested by visual comparison of the source with hard copy plots. The data was also compared to the digital orthophotography.  The updated building rooftops are captured from the orthophotography as best as can be done.  There is probably a higher level of error for these sources of buildings.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>

        <srccitea>GISMGR.BUILDINGS</srccitea>
        <srccontr>Layer that contains buildings in SDE</srccontr>
      </srcinfo>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>The planimetric features were stereocompiled from the controlled set of 1''=660' scale photography.  Each map feature was captured in a specific and consistent manner.  All data is geo-referenced at the time of compilation, ensuring the integration of the photogrammetric models into the County Tax Map grid system.</procdesc>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <proccont>
          <cntinfo>
            <cntorgp>
              <cntorg>Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services</cntorg>
            </cntorgp>
            <cntpos>GIS Data/Database Administrator</cntpos>
            <cntaddr>
              <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>
              <address>12000 Government Center Pw. Suite 117</address>
              <city>Fairfax</city>
              <state>VA</state>
              <postal>22035</postal>
              <country>USA</country>
            </cntaddr>
            <cntvoice>(703)-324-2712</cntvoice>
            <cntfax>(703)-324-3937</cntfax>
            <cntemail>gis.helpq@fairfaxcounty.gov</cntemail>
          </cntinfo>
        </proccont>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Set the compilation model on analytical stereo plotters</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING1</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING2</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Digitize planimetric features into a file</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING2</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING3</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Translate the raw digitized data into APS (ASI's internal processing software)</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING3</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING4</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Check for validation errors (i.e. arcs with only two points or invalid feature code/element type combinations and delete empty features such as annotation with no printable characters in the text string</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING4</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING5</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Snap graphic features to other as necessary, offset features the required distances and break features with others.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING5</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING6</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Load all necessary models for a particular tile and extract all planimetric feature data within that tile's boundary</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING6</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING7</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Tile is plotted at 1''=200' for manual edit checks.  Plot is checked for correct capture of all required features types, missing features and mis-snapped linework and unsnapped linework.  Attributes and annotation are placed on the check plot for entry into the database.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING7</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING8</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>First graphic edit.  All errors noted are corrected, attributes and annotation are placed, general topology check, building all polygons for the appropriate coverage's, check for dangles, redundant lines and duplicate or missing label points.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING8</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING9</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Second graphic edit.  All polygon coverage's are rebuilt in batch mode with errors being flagged and text is generated from the attributes found on certain planimetric layers.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING9</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING10</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Translation. This is a two step process.  First step transforms all graphic elements along with their associated attributes into ArcInfo format.  The second step enters into Arcedit and performs build topology operations and joins as required for each coverage, removes pseudo nodes and copies the projection file to each coverage.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING10</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING11</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>ArcInfo QC. Checks for the existence and validity of all required coverage's, proper item definitions, attributes with valid values and correct annotation sizes and subclass/level definitions.  This also checks for data along the edges of the coverage to ensure that all data ties to the adjoining files both in location and in attribute values.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING11</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING12</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Color check plots are created of the tile with the full set of planimetric and topographic features.</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING12</srcused>
        <procdate>1997-1998</procdate>
        <srcprod>BUILDING13</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Data is reviewed by on site quality control contractor, Engineering Systems.  The quality control review combines both automated and manual checks.  Automated checks of the coverage's to ensure that all coverage's existed with the correct data structure and that the attributes existed with valid data.  Manual checks of the data included review of the information overlaid on the digital orthophotography to check for completeness and accuracy as per the specifications of the RFP</procdesc>
        <srcused>BUILDING13</srcused>
        <procdate/>
        <srcprod>BUILDING14</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Add proposed building footprints from site plans submitted to Fairfax County GIS office.  Digitize site plans and place buildings on appropriate layer and best fitting site plan on location from coordinates specified in the site plan.  Use most current orthophotography if available to adjust location.</procdesc>
        <srcused>Site Plan</srcused>
        <procdate/>
        <srcprod>GISMGR.BUILDINGS</srcprod>
      </procstep>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Data copied from the CD obtained from Fairfax County, VA 2007.
Heads up digitize building rooftops from 2002 Commonwealth of Virginia ortho photography or 2003 Fairfax County ortho photography.  If buildings are no longer on the photography but still appear in the layer they are moved to the expired buildings layer and given an expiration date. Versioned editing is used to perform this process.</procdesc>
        <srcused>GISMGR.BUILDINGS</srcused>
        <procdate>Unknown</procdate>
        <srcprod>GISMGR.BUILDINGS</srcprod>
        <srcprod>GISMGR.BUILDINGS_EXPIRED</srcprod>
      </procstep>
    </lineage>
  </dataqual>
  <spdoinfo>
    <direct>Vector</direct>

    <overview>
      <eaover>Buildings are stored as polygons.  Each polygon contains building name (if known from source ), building type, effective date. expiry date, and source attributes</eaover>

      <fees>Property & Topography Data.  This data set includes over 30 layers of attributed vector property, planimetric, and contour data that were derived primarily from survey plats and orthophotography.  The Countywide Property & Topography 4 CD set in Coverage format sells for $2850.  The Countywide Property & Topography 3 CD set in Shapefile format sells for $2850.  Property & Topography by Map Grid Tile data on CD is available in Coverage or Shapefile fomat.  There is a $25 base charge per order plus an additonal fee of $13 per tax map grid tile. The Countywide Property & Topography Data Dictionary.</fees>
    </stdorder>
  </distinfo>
